intro: Hibbertia camphorosma, commonly known as the camphor weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five spreading petals. The plant is an erect shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with hairy, often reddish stems and alternate leaves. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions, often found in coastal and sandy regions. Hibbertia camphorosma is also known for its aromatic leaves, which contain compounds similar to camphor.
